intro: Cheiranthus pallens, commonly known as the pale cheiranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. The species is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
